intro: Leucothauma chlorosolen, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
